summary: Email correspondence between an NYPD/FBI detective and a witness regarding a subpoena in the Epstein investigation. The detective clarifies that the witness does not need to appear in court as they have agreed to a virtual interview, and discusses the witness's option to have an attorney present.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force detective
persons.context: The detective is coordinating a virtual interview with a witness regarding the Epstein investigation, sending a subpoena and clarifying procedural details.

events.title: Proposed virtual interview
events.description: A virtual interview is proposed for 1PM on Thursday, September 10, 2020, as part of the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: A subpoena was issued in the Epstein investigation as of September 2020, indicating ongoing investigative activity.
The witness is being interviewed virtually, not required to appear in court, as they agreed to a video conference.
The detective explicitly states that the decision to have an attorney present is left to the witness's comfort level, and it is not required.
